text: On 19 February 2020, two mass shootings occurred, targeting two shisha bars in Hanau, Hesse, Germany. Nine people were murdered and many others seriously wounded. After the attacks, the alleged perpetrator killed his mother and committed suicide. Police believe these attacks to have had a xenophobic, right-wing extremist motive. Chancellor Angela Merkel cancelled a planned trip to Halle, Saxony-Anhalt and expressed her condolences to the victims' families. ==References== Category:2020 crimes in Europe Category:2020s in Germany Category:2020s mass shootings in Europe Category:February 2020 events Shootings Category:Mass murder in Germany Category:Mass murder in 2020 Category:Suicide in 2020 Category:Terrorist incidents in Germany Category:Terrorist incidents in the 2020s
